attributes.PROJECT_FICHE_SHORT_TITLE: Hydrogen interconnector from the North-South backbone in East to Oude (NL) - H2ercules North (DE)
attributes.PROJECT_FULL_TITLE: Hydrogen interconnector from the North-South backbone in East to Oude (NL) - H2ercules North (DE)
attributes.TECHNICAL_DESCR:
The project is aiming to establish cross border hydrogen transport capacity between Germany and the Netherlands. The network National H2 Backbone (HNS) - H2ercules Network (OGE) can establish a connection to five European countries (Norway, Netherlands, Belgium, France and Czech Republic) via pipeline.

The project concerns the hydrogen transport through the cross-border point Oude Statenzijl.

It covers the following infrastructure in Germany:

  • Wilhelmshaven/Dornum – Wettringen (H2ercules Network North) - new gas pipeline of approx. 240 km.
  • Wettringen – Werne (H2ercules Network North) - repurposed gas pipeline of approx. 74 km.
  • Hamm/Werne – Krefeld (H2ercules Network North) new gas pipeline of approx. 120 km.

The project aims to realise 52.8 GWh/d (0.5 Mt/y) of green hydrogen transmission capacity from the Netherlands to Germany.
attributes.PROMOTERS: N.V. Nederlandse Gasunie (NE) ; Open Grid Europe GmbH (DE)
